intro: Siphocampylus manettiiflorus var. libanensis, commonly known as the Lebanon siphocampylus, is a rare flowering plant native to the Levant region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in compound umbels. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a serrated margin and a distinctive, fragrant aroma. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
